numbered_ace_sentences: 2. I notice that legacy students are more likely to be admitted into a college than non-legacy students.
4. The trend indicates that legacy students are far more likely to be admitted into an Ivy League college than non-legacy students.
5. I notice that rich non-legacy students are less likely to be admitted into a college than poor non-legacy students.
6. I notice that rich legacy students have the biggest advantage for admission into an Ivy League college.
7. I wonder why admission officials care so much about legacy status.
8. I wonder whether legacy status increases profit.
9. I wonder why wealthy non-legacy students have a lower chance of admission into a college.
10. My classmates will start the college process soon.
11. I will start the college process soon.
12. Knowledge about legacy status can be a huge factor in the college process.
13. Knowledge about wealth can be a huge factor in the college process.
15. The question is: Do I have a lower chance of admission into a college because I have no legacy status and no wealth?
16. This situation seems to create an unfair advantage for some students.
17. This situation concerns some people in my community.
18. The headline is: Wealth and legacy - is this mainly what admissions care about?
